_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Mountain Conditions
12/29 3 PM Update:  Snow conditions stayed excellent throughout the day with smooth carving and hidden powder stashes in all the right places. Southback and Northway both delivered quality laps since their opening and the energy stayed high. We'll see you tomorrow to do it all over again!

Notes for today:
  1. Although early season conditions still exist widespread around the mountain, there are pockets of deeper snow. Read up on Tree Well and Snow Immersion Safety before heading out on the slopes, and please take it easy out there, especially in higher traffic areas. 
  2. We've got plenty of room here on the mountain! Shuttles are running and we're stoked to get folks back on the hill. Book your shuttle today!  
  3. Ski & ride with care. We know youre excited, and we are too. Please ride responsibly and stay in control today as we launch the 2025-2026 Winter Season. Brush up on Mountain Safety and the Responsibility Code!
  4. Obey all mountain closures. Our team is working hard to open terrain as quickly and safely as possible. Closed areas are closed for a reason, so please keep yourself and our team safe by only skiing in open areas.
  5. As a reminder, when being added from the parking waitlist, cancellations are still required if you're not planning on making it up. Thank you!
  6. At this time, paid reservations can only be cancelled by emailing SP+ at  CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. The Crystal Mountain Contact center cannot process these cancellations. 

Food and Beverage Hours

Brew 62:  7:00am-4pm
MCL Food Hall:  7:00am-10:30am for Grab+Go, Hot Line Open 10:30am-8pm
Bootpack Bar: 10:30am-8pm
Summit House: 10:30am-2:30pm (last seating)
Midway Yurt: 10:30am-4pm
Campbell Basin Lodge:   10:30am-3pm (Bathrooms + Grab+Go at 9am)
Rafters: 10:30am to 8pm
Quickstop Yurt:  11am-7pm
Tower 16:   Closed
Fireside Cantina:  Closed


Uphill Travel Update: See the above banner for the current status. Uphill travel is no longer permitted into Southback for the remainder of the season. Please visit guest services to get your 25/26 uphill travel card, this must be renewed free of charge for the season. Uphill travel may be prohibited at any time as mountain operations teams conduct avalanche mitigation. Refer to the "No Uphill Travel" lights around the base area and the Mountain Report page indicating the status of the designated route. These lights are located by the Gondola trail map, bottom of Chinook, bottom of Discovery, and top of Quicksilver lift shack. For more information about uphill travel, please visit the uphill travel page. 

Mountain Weather 12/29/2025 4:20pm 

Synopsis: Cool clear nights and filtered sunny days are the name of the game right now. A prominent ridge of high pressure is lingering over the region until it shifts eastward on Wednesday. A shift to SW winds on Tuesday will bring more warm air above 5000, while cool air pools over the Columbia basin. With this warm and cold air mixing, we hopefully wont get as drastic of a warmup as the freezing levels seem to say.   
Monday Night:  
Sky Cover: High clouds in the evening, then clearing skies
Freezing Elevation: 10,000
12hr Precip: None
Wind Trends: Light W
Tuesday: 
Sky Cover: Mostly Sunny
Freezing Elevation: 10,000 increasing to 11,000'
12hr Precip: None
Wind Trends: Light SW
Tuesday Night:  
Sky Cover: Mostly Clear
Freezing Elevation: 11,000'
12hr Precip: None
Wind Trends: Light SW
 
Outlook: Unfortunately, the pool of cold air loses strength on Wednesday as clouds trickle in and precipitation picks back up. Expect a wintry mix of precipitation on Thursday through Friday.

Forecaster: Morgan McGonagle



SPECIAL OPERATIONS UPDATE: RETURN TO REGULAR OPERATIONS


  • We have returned to our regular parking plan, with parking reservations required Friday 12/26 to 1/4 during the holiday period and onwards on weekend/Holidays.
  • Parking arrivals after 12 p.m. noon without a parking reservation are now permitted.  
  • Parking on days without reservation requirements and for arrivals after 12 p.m. noon are on a first come, first served basis.  
  • Guests on the parking waitlist for regularly required reservation days have been added to confirmed reservation, if space is available on the given day.  Guests still on the wait list will be notified if spaces become available.  System errors have been corrected, apologies and thank you to those who helped flag the glitches.  
  • Parking reservation refunds will go out for all of the previously required midweek days that were booked during our interim parking plan. Refunds may take 7-10 business to appear in your account. No action is needed for this refund. 
  • Parking reservation refunds are available for advanced bookings of reservation on regularly required days, offered only through 12/31.  If no action is taken, the advanced reservation will remain and become non-refundable.  No show policy will apply.  
    • For these type of refunds email: CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. Additional follow-up with some accounts may apply.  Note: the Crystal Mountain Contact Center cannot cancel reservations.  
  • Crystal Mountain Express Shuttle reservations are now available for service starting 12/26, on the normal 7 day rolling window.
  • Day tickets are available for tomorrow 12/24 and onwards. 
  • Deferral option on Crystal local passes to end 12/24, and Ikon Pass $50 deferral to end by 12/24. If you have already deferred your pass, you can call the Ikon Contact Center 888-365-IKON or 303-729-3174 to resume use this season.  
  • For up to the date information on Highway 410, please visit the WSDOT website.
Thank you all for your understanding and patience as we navigating this challenging time.  We look forward to seeing you at Crystal Mountain this season!


25/26 WINTER PRODUCTS & PASSES

  • NIGHT SKIING HAS BEEN EXTENDED FOR THE 25/26 SEASON! FROM 28 to 53 NIGHTS! Read full announcement 
  • Daily lift tickets are now on sale, plus $62 Tuesday's are NOW DOUBLED! Every 2nd and now 4th Tuesday of the 25/26 season, ride for only $62! Lock in your holiday plans, or your next trip with savings you can't beat. Purchase now and save later.
  • Performance Ski, Snowboard and Beginner Rental Pass: ON SALE NOW! 
  • Tune Pass: Premier and Base available for purchase!
  • Demo Pass: Lock in the best gear of the 25/26 season with unlimited use!
  • 25/26 3-Day Midweek & Anytime Passes: Your pass to the perfect powder day, groomer day or when conditions are right for you. Purchase today and gear up for a rad winter.
  • Afternoon Pass: With extended night skiing dates, take your Afternoon Pass to the next level!

25/26 WINTER PROGRAMS,CLINICS, AND NECESSITIES

  • Ski and Ride School: Explore our programs and find your right fit.
  • Freeride Program (NEW! Adult Programs now available): Registration now open, limited spots available! 
  • AIARE Course & Certification: Ski the backcountry with expert knowledge and certification
  • Seasonal Gear storage: Hassle-free on mountain storage with limited availability, lock your space in today!
  • Seasonal Lockers: For you or the entire family, check out options today .
  • Full Day Seasonal Lesson Programs for 4-6 year olds are now available- with lunch included too!   
  • Secure your spot. Already signed up for a 2-hour session and want to upgrade? No problemjust call us at 833-279-7895

In case of on-mountain emergency: Call 360-663-3064 or 911
